population Module¶

Class to represent poulations data.

class population.Population(N, T, Z, G=None)[source]¶

A generic class that represent populations data.

Parameters:
  • N (int) – Population size.
  • Z (float) – Population resident phenotype.
  • G (float) – Population resident genotype.
  • T (int) – Patch size.

Attributes

Name Value
Population.N Population size (int)
Population.T Aggregation patch size (int)
Population.resident_phenotype Resident phenotype of the population (float)
Population.resident_genotype Resident genotype of the population (float)
Population.phenotype Individual phenotype (N np.array float)
Population.genotype Individual genotype (N np.array float)
Population.payoff Individual payoff (N np.array float)
Population.group Individual “is in a group ?” (N np.array bool)
flush()[source]¶

Shuffle individuals arrays and reset the group/payoff arrays.

group_density(z)[source]¶

Return the group distribution of z-social individuals.

Parameters:z (float) – social trait value.
Returns:numpy array [1,T] – density of groups.
group_number(i)[source]¶

Return the group of individual i, 0 if none.

Parameters:i (int) – individual number < self.N.
Returns:int – group number or 0 if alone.
trait_number(z)[source]¶

Return the number of individual having a social trait of z.

Parameters:z (float) – social trait value.
Returns:int – number of “z-individuals”.
traits_values()[source]¶

Return the list of phenotype values found in this population.

Returns:numpy array – array of unique occurences in Population.phenotype.
update()[source]¶

Update the internal cache variable after the aggregation proccess (i.e group_size).
